author: Special Correspondent
text:
Seeks ticket to contest from Manaveli constituency

Former PMK Puducherry unit secretary R.K.R.Anantharaman, who is a close relative PMK founder S.Ramadoss on Sunday joined Congress party here.

Immediately after joining the Congress, Mr. Anantharaman submitted an application seeking to contest on the party ticket in Manaveli constituency in the forthcoming polls.

Last November, Mr. Anantharaman was dismissed from the primary membership of the PMK for bringing disrepute to the party.

He was named as an accused in connection with the murder of Vanniyar Sangam vice -president Moorthy in Sembanaarkoil in Nagapattinam district a year ago. Anantharaman had unsuccessfully contested in the last Lok Sabha elections on a PMK ticket in Puducherry.

Mr. Anantharaman along with his supporters took out a rally towards the Congress party office and obtained a membership card from the Pradesh Congress Committee (PCC) president A.Namassivayam in the presence of former Union Minister V.Narayanasamy.

Talking to reporters, Mr. Namassivayam said party president Sonia Gandhi and vice president Rahul Gandhi will take final decision on seat sharing between Congress and DMK.

Pointing out about C Djeacoumar, who was yet to submit the application expressing desire to contest, Mr. Namassivayam said that the Congress high command had the powers to give ticket to a person, even if he did not submit such an application.
title: Former PMK secretary joins Congress
